meanings.definition: a shout of encouragement, praise, or joy
meanings.sent1: The crowd let out a cheer when the team scored a goal.
meanings.sent2: I heard a cheer from the audience after the performance.
meanings.sent3: The cheer from the fans motivated the players to do their best.
meanings.sent4: Her cheer echoed through the stadium, filling everyone with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The cheer of the crowd was deafening, showing their support for the team.

meanings.definition: a feeling of happiness or positivity
meanings.sent1: Seeing her smile filled me with cheer.
meanings.sent2: The holiday season always brings a sense of cheer to the town.
meanings.sent3: His cheerful attitude spread cheer to everyone around him.
meanings.sent4: The cheer in the air was contagious, lifting everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The cheer in her voice was evident, reflecting her inner joy.

meanings.definition: to make happier or more cheerful
meanings.sent1: I tried to cheer up my friend by telling jokes.
meanings.sent2: Her favorite song never fails to cheer her during tough times.
meanings.sent3: The funny movie managed to cheer him up after a long day.
meanings.sent4: The surprise visit from her family cheered her immensely.
meanings.sent5: The kind words from her friend cheered her instantly.

meanings.definition: to applaud or shout in support or praise
meanings.sent1: The audience began to cheer as the speaker concluded his speech.
meanings.sent2: We all cheered for our friend as she crossed the finish line.
meanings.sent3: The students decided to cheer for their teacher during the assembly.
meanings.sent4: The fans continued to cheer for their team despite the rain.
meanings.sent5: The crowd started to cheer loudly, showing their appreciation for the performance.
